thread.title: Voice of the Mirror: People demonstrating for the future of the NHS are doing it for us all
thread.title_full: Voice of the Mirror: People demonstrating for the future of the NHS are doing it for us all

author: Voice of the Mirror
title: Voice of the Mirror: People demonstrating for the future of the NHS are doing it for us all
text:
'Let's Save the NHS' rally and protest march (Photo: PA) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
The tens of thousands marching on today’s National Health Service protest in Central London are demonstrating for us all. 
Because the NHS needs friends and supporters more than ever when Tory cuts threaten the very existence of this life-saving public service. 
Frontline staff perform medical miracles and they as much as patients feel the heartbreaking damage inflicted by Conservative austerity. 
Precious resources squandered on bureaucratic upheavals and ideological privatisation should have been spent instead on GP surgeries and hospitals. 
Slashing spending on social care then denying the NHS the money needed is political vandalism, an act of unforgivable spite. Read More They're demonstrating for us all (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
As one of the world’s biggest economies we could easily afford a first-class health service. 
This is about priorities, not the deficit. And Theresa May’s Tory Government does not value the NHS as much as we all do. 
So thank you to the marchers. You represent the millions. Mrs May champions the millionaires. Like us on Facebook
